portfolioImage.title: Legatum That Spark C02
portfolioImage.imageCaption: A girl plays with a balloon borrowed from the Ruo Mu Community Centre in Zhengzhou

entry.portfolioIntro: The Social Sector Development Initiative launched in 2011 as a three-year initiative to encourage the growth, effectiveness, and sustainability of China's social sector.

portfolioBlocks.heading: Background
portfolioBlocks.text: China’s recent economic rise and societal shifts have led to a massive drop in poverty levels. Twenty years ago, 69% of the population lived in poverty. Today that number is less than 6%. As a result, China has a nascent social sector and a new generation of philanthropists, volunteers and social entrepreneurs. The sector has been inventing itself, at first through international support and more recently through local resources.

portfolioBlocks.heading: Approach
portfolioBlocks.text:
For the social sector to grow and to accelerate high-quality development, well-equipped grantees were supported and empowered to take risks required to scale.

The initiative supported 14 social sector organisations, investing in building internal systems and creating tools to help catalyse growth. All 14 organisations achieved their project targets.

portfolioBlocks.heading: Analysis
portfolioBlocks.text:
This initiative demonstrated the power of measured risk-taking and how it can catalyse and accelerate change.

Each of the 14 partners achieved their project targets. Together, they reached 21,542 individuals and built capacity among 790 individual social sector organisations in over 100 cities across China.

The projects also had a multiplier effect with the training of trainers and the creation of handbooks and toolkits.

person.title: Alan McCormick
person.personShortBio: Alan co-founded Legatum, driving the creation of much of the firm's social investment portfolio
person.personFullBiography:
Alan McCormick is a Partner of Legatum. He has been with the firm since its inception in 2006 serving in various capacities with a wide range of management responsibilities across the group. He was formerly part of Legatum’s predecessor, Sovereign Asset Management, and a member of its special situations team.

Alan, along with his Partners, has driven the incubation of much of Legatum’s social investment portfolio where he also plays a governance role for organisations including the END Fund, Freedom Fund, Luminos Fund, the Legatum Center for Entrepreneurship at MIT and the Legatum Institute Foundation which is based in London.

entry.title: The Librarian: A China Social Sector photo essay
entry.metaDescription: Photographer Alice Carfrae visited The Ruo Mu Community Centre, where she met Mr. Hu, a quiet man with a passion for reading

portfolioPeople.title: Alan McCormick
portfolioPeople.personShortBio: Alan co-founded Legatum, driving the creation of much of the firm's social investment portfolio
portfolioPeople.personFullBiography:
Alan McCormick is a Partner of Legatum. He has been with the firm since its inception in 2006 serving in various capacities with a wide range of management responsibilities across the group. He was formerly part of Legatum’s predecessor, Sovereign Asset Management, and a member of its special situations team.

Alan, along with his Partners, has driven the incubation of much of Legatum’s social investment portfolio where he also plays a governance role for organisations including the END Fund, Freedom Fund, Luminos Fund, the Legatum Center for Entrepreneurship at MIT and the Legatum Institute Foundation which is based in London.

portfolioPeople.title: Christopher Chandler

personImage.title: Christopher Chandler: Chairman and Partner of Legatum

portfolioPeople.personShortBio: Christopher was the founding partner of Legatum and currently serves as Chairman
portfolioPeople.personFullBiography:
Christopher Chandler is the Chairman and founding partner of Legatum. He has worked with his partners to establish a number of the firm’s key philanthropic endeavours, including the END Fund, Freedom Fund, Luminos Fund, the Legatum Center for Development and Entrepreneurship at MIT, and the Legatum Institute Foundation in London.

Prior to Legatum, Christopher was the Co-Founder of the Monaco-based Sovereign Global group, which specialised in emerging-market investments for over two decades.

Christopher holds degrees in business and law from the University of Auckland, New Zealand.

portfolioPeople.title: Mark Stoleson
portfolioPeople.personShortBio: Mark co-founded Legatum with his partners in 2006 and now serves as Chief Executive Officer
portfolioPeople.personFullBiography:
Mark Stoleson is the Chief Executive Officer and a Partner of Legatum.

He has been with the firm since its inception in 2006 and has served in various capacities including Head of Group Investments. Mark has worked with his partners at Legatum to incubate a number of the firm’s key philanthropic endeavours including the END Fund, Freedom Fund, Luminos Fund, The Legatum Center for Development and Entrepreneurship at MIT, and the Legatum Institute Foundation in London.

Prior to Legatum, Mark was a corporate finance and M&A attorney with Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld.

He holds a BA in International Relations from Occidental College and a JD-LLM from Duke University School of Law.

portfolioPeople.title: Philip Vassiliou
portfolioPeople.personShortBio: Philip co-founded Legatum. He leads the investment team and is also Chair of the Luminos Fund
portfolioPeople.personFullBiography:
Philip Vassiliou is the Chief Investment Officer and a Partner of Legatum. He has been with the firm since its inception in 2006 and is primarily responsible for the oversight of Legatum’s capital markets activities. Philip is also Chair of the Luminos Fund, a philanthropic initiative founded by Legatum which is dedicated to advancing education innovations for the world’s most vulnerable children.

Prior to Legatum, Philip previously worked for the Dubai Development Investment Authority, and in the Equities & Private Wealth divisions of Goldman Sachs in New York and London.

Philip holds a Bachelor of Science from Babson College.

portfolioRelated.title: Accelerated Learning Programmes
portfolioRelated.metaDescription: The Accelerated Learning Programme was designed to give students who had missed out on education the opportunity to transition into the mainstream schools

portfolioRelated.title: The END Fund

metaImage.title: END Fund: part of the Legatum Portfolio

portfolioRelated.metaDescription: The END Fund’s purpose is to control and eliminate the five most prevalent neglected tropical diseases by 2030.

portfolioRelated.title: The Luminos Fund

metaImage.title: Luminos Fund: part of the Legatum Portfolio

portfolioRelated.metaDescription: The Luminos Fund gives children excluded from school due to poverty, conflict or discrimination, a second chance for a mainstream education

portfolioRelated.title: The Freedom Fund

metaImage.title: Freedom Fund: part of the Legatum Portfolio

portfolioRelated.metaDescription: The Freedom Fund was founded in 2013 to form the first private collaborative fund to abolish modern slavery

relatedArticles.title: How Nations Succeed; a report from the Legatum Institute explores why some nations fail while others succeed
relatedArticles.metaDescription: The Legatum Institute has published a report providing an analysis of the choices and steps made by countries with successful journeys towards prosperity.

relatedArticles.title: Legatum Institute launches the 14th edition of the Legatum Prosperity Index

metaImage.title: The Legatum Institute's 2020 Legatum Prosperity Index

relatedArticles.metaDescription: The Legatum Prosperity Index is the only global index that measures national prosperity based on institutional, economic, and social wellbeing.
